intro: Hisingera flexuosa, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive zigzagging stems, which give it its common name. The plant has opposite, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Hisingera flexuosa is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
